text: The baseball bats are metaphorical. I grew up in the bush. I’m not interested in stereotyping anyone in regional Australia.

text: More theories about my background. We could actually blast off here shortly. Might leave you to that. All the best.

text: If that was the crux of my argument, I’d need to reassess it, but given it isn’t, I’ll just leave you to keep those left right combinations swinging at the air if that seems like a good use of your Saturday.

text: Aly wants Morrison to reflect on his language in relation to asylum seekers. His Trumpian language. Rapists, and so forth. Doesn't that create an environment of prejudice? Morrison says he's not in the sugar coating business #auspol

text: Morrison will not commit, in this interview, to putting PHON below Labor and the Greens. He needs to see the candidates #auspol

text: It never happened. I've always been deeply concerned about attitudes to Muslims in the community. I've always acted consistently with that, Morrison says #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: So the PM now acknowledges a discussion took place in shadow cabinet. Morrison says his contribution was about lowering the fears about Muslims, not elevating them #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: Aly gets to the report of the shadow cabinet discussion. What did you say, Aly asks? Morrison acknowledges he raised fears in the community about Muslims. The PM says the point of raising them was to address the fears #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: I think the answer is not to retreat into tribes, the PM says, the answer is to better understand where people are coming from, rather than line people up into teams #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: My example has been to work with the Muslim community, Morrison says #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: Morrison is attempting to defend Peter Dutton's comments about Lebanese migrants. Aly persists. Does the party have a problem with Islamophobia. Morrison says he doesn't believe so #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: Morrison says his time in parliament has been about bringing communities together. "The best way for me to address any problem is to lead by example," the PM says #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: Aly is handing the detailed record to the PM about what his colleagues have said and done in recent months. Do you need to confront something within your party, Aly asks? #auspol

text: Morrison is back on needing to disagree better, and about not reaching prejudiced conclusions about others #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: Morrison says he doesn't think Australians understand Islam very well. The PM acknowledges Islamophobia exists in Australia. He says the Liberal party doesn't have a problem with Islamophobia #auspol

text: As the Christchurch attacks unfolded, I knew I had to quit my job at Sky News
author: murpharoo

text: This is what I mean about opportunity trolling. It’s a bit off, isn’t it. Incomprehensible to me actually. Good luck with it.
author: murpharoo

text: I’m not complacent. I’m the opposite of complacent. This is why the conversation is confusing.
author: murpharoo

text: I interrogate media practice, my own, and others, frequently. That gives me no discomfort at all. I know we play a role; written a book arguing we are part of the contemporary problem. What makes me uncomfortable? People roaming around looking for fights in a middle of a tragedy.
author: murpharoo

text: I’m not lecturing anybody. That’s a strange thing to say, when it’s clearly a plea, which you are obviously free to take or leave.
author: murpharoo

text: If this issue had a simple solution, we’d have happened upon it by now. But retweeting today’s outrage does nothing apart from hang a lantern over it.
author: murpharoo

text: It’s a complicated issue, something we obviously grapple with all the time. There’s a difference between reporting as an act of interrogation/fact checking, which is a civic responsibility, and straight out amplification, which the echo chambers allow.
author: murpharoo

text: I tried polite, now I’ll be direct. Nick off. Have some respect for yourself, but more importantly, for the dead and the people mourning them. This isn’t a seminar. Stop your ambulance chasing. If you want a fight, find one elsewhere.
author: murpharoo

text: Please, please, don’t share/amplify the senator’s pathetic look at me. It only gratifies him. It changes nothing else at all #auspol
author: murpharoo

text: It was Four Corners. And yes, and I’m comfortable with my rationale. If you want to pick a fight in order to make today’s tragedy somehow about you, or me, just a polite tip: find another hobby, because I won’t be helping you out.

text: Laziness is not an affliction I suffer from. I didn’t say Labor is scared of the boats issue. I said they don’t really want to talk about it. I said that because they don’t, and I know that because I speak to ALP people. It’s not a guess. But you can have your own view obviously.
author: murpharoo

text: You won’t regret it.
author: murpharoo

text: In any case, happy just to read and not to respond if that’s preferable. Probably preferable for me. Certainly preferable for loved ones who would prefer I spoke to them. I just have this weird idea my job requires a conversation. Anyhow, . Must catch a plane
author: murpharoo

text: It always intrigues me when people say I repeat talking points, or I’m manipulated, or I’m biased, that they then seem offended when I rebut these claims. As if I’ve been, somehow, offensive. It never ceases to amaze me. Perhaps I’m not supposed to respond.
author: murpharoo

text: Can I just note, with great respect, that it’s not precious or snappy to respond to accusations/insights/critiques/feelings. Sometimes I respond with: what are you talking about, because it’s not always clear. This might sound like an insult, but it’s a question.
author: murpharoo

text: Who is us? Is there an us?
author: murpharoo

text: Well by all means take that up with people who fall into that category.
author: murpharoo

text: Yes, polls suggest that’s the case. Presumably people don’t feel the bullets that get dodged.
